name: Yoshihiro Kanamori
content: Yoshihiro Kanamori's homepage [English | Japanese] Yoshihiro Kanamori Ph.D. in Computer Science, Professor Affiliation: Department of Computer Science, Institute of Systems and Information Engineering, University of Tsukuba Concurrently: Center for Artificial Intelligence Research (C-AIR), University of Tsukuba Teaching: Graduate School: Master's/Doctoral Program in Computer Science, Degree Programs in Systems and Information Engineering, Graduate School of Science and Technology (ex: Department of Computer Science, Graduate School of Systems and Information Engineering) Undergraduate: College of Media Arts, Science and Technology (MAST), School of Informatics Laboratory: Computational Geometry and Graphics Laboratory (CGG) (ex: Non-numerical Processing Algorithm Laboratory (NPAL)) Google Scholar Address in Univ. of Tsukuba: Tennoudai 1-1-1, Tsukuba, Ibaraki, 305-8573, Japan [map] Office: Room #1108, Laboratory of Advanced Research B (Phone: +81.29.853.5483, ext. 5483) Lab 1: Room #1125, Laboratory of Advanced Research B (Phone/Fax: +81.29.853.5600, ext. 8473) Lab 2: Room #925, Laboratory of Advanced Research B (Phone/Fax: +81.29.853.5388) E-mail: kanamori(AT)cs.tsukuba.ac.jp Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any requests/questions. Short biography ¶ Yoshihiro Kanamori received his B.S., M.S., and Ph.D. degrees in computer science from the University of Tokyo, Japan, in 2003, 2005, and 2009, respectively. He is a professor in the University of Tsukuba. He was a visiting researcher in ETH Zurich from 2014 to 2016 funded by the postdoctoral fellowship for research abroad of Japan Society for the Promotion of Science (JSPS). He also stayed in the University of Edinburgh as a visiting researcher in 2019. His research interests center on computer graphics, especially rendering, image processing, and applications of deep learning. For international students ¶ You can apply to the MEXT scholarship for our master's/doctoral programs in computer science. For more details, please visit [this page]. Lectures ¶ 2025 [manaba] Human-centered AI A (Spring C) [manaba] Human-centered AI B (Autumn B) For other lectures, please see the Japanese page. English Documents for Students ¶ Guidelines for Research Paper Introduction Research interests ¶ Computer graphics (CG), rendering, deep learning, image editing techniques, and CG applications for industry.
